summary: The Eliminating Fraud and Improper Payments in TANF Act aims to strengthen the integrity of the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) program. It mandates the application of the Payment Integrity Information Act of 2019 to state programs funded under TANF. The bill also requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to submit a report to Congress outlining a plan to reduce or eliminate improper payments within 10 years. The amendment is set to take effect on October 1, 2026.
